title: List Champions whose burst/ulti is countered by Zhonya's...

replies.body: I agree, turn all burst mages into Zeds.
{{champion:45}} +{{champion:238}} =?

> [{quoted}](name=HeadHonchkrow,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T10:16:48.691+0000)
>
> {{champion:45}} +{{champion:238}} =?

Satan {{champion:17}}

Just you wait, Riot is going to give Teemo 100% AP Scaling on all of his abilities, except for his E. That one gets 50%.
The League of Teemo awaits you...
Garen's ult has no refund...

The ironie is: Zed's ultimate lasts 3 seconds, while Zhonya's lasts 2.5 seconds
That means he can actually still use his active items to amplify his item damage - simply by button mashing next to the target.
(Also his normal abilities, but that requires more timing)


Meanwhile other abilities are gettign truely countered by it... And have a much longer CD than Zed's ultimate.

> [{quoted}](name=Kowe The Ewok,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-01-08T08:02:58.177+0000)
>
> The ironie is: Zed's ultimate lasts 3 seconds, while Zhonya's lasts 2.5 seconds
> That means he can actually still use his active items to amplify his item damage - simply by button mashing next to the target.
> (Also his normal abilities, but that requires more timing)
> 
> 
> Meanwhile other abilities are gettign truely countered by it... And have a much longer CD than Zed's ultimate.

Here is a tip that might improve your games. You can Zhonya's right before the mark is applied during the animation and negate Zed ult completely. Saw this on stream just 2 days ago.

Even with this useful information, everyone would still complain.

"WAAHHHHH Zed's ult is uncounterable!"

> [{quoted}](name=meatjunjun,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T09:44:05.766+0000)
>
> Even with this useful information, everyone would still complain.
> 
> "WAAHHHHH Zed's ult is uncounterable!"

No, I think you're missing the point.

None of these other champions get to be overbearing simply because Zhonya's counters their burst.  But for Zed, it's always the fall-back excuse to defend his ridiculous state.

Next you'll see someone tell us we should've rushed an MR item (QSS) against him, with no defensive or offensive stats for the lane and no mana regen, simply to survive when he dives you at 6.

> [{quoted}](name=Jangle BoJangles,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T09:59:48.501+0000)
>
> No, I think you're missing the point.
> 
> None of these other champions get to be overbearing simply because Zhonya's counters their burst.  But for Zed, it's always the fall-back excuse to defend his ridiculous state.
> 
> Next you'll see someone tell us we should've rushed an MR item (QSS) against him, with no defensive or offensive stats for the lane and no mana regen, simply to survive when he dives you at 6.

The thing with Zed is, he basically telegraphs it and gives you 4-5 seconds to react (1-2 seconds to apply the mark while he's untargetable, and then 3 seconds before it detonates).

With all the other ults, if you don't react quick enough (or have high ping), you'll still get hit by it even if you had a zhonya.

I don't completely agree with this, while the fact is true.

Lux ult still has a indicator, pretty obvious at that. I also am on east coast with 150 ping average. I have never had any problem with pressing Zhonya's in that amount of time, I see your arguments point, I just don't think with OP's example, that is is a valid excuse. And along with that, Lux will probably try and snare you first, if that snare hits. You should know to Zhonyas.

Its because of the simple and primary difference between assassins and other champions. 

For an assassin to kill someone, they NEED to use an entire rotation of spells. Or they're incredibly fed, but what can you do about that? But I digress. An assassin's burst is reliant on their full kit to do their damage. Every other champion you listed have other ways to do reliable damage. Mages have low cd spells, carries have their AAs, etc, etc.
Talon has other ways to do reliable damage? I don't think you meant to say every

This is the dumbest "bash Zed" thread I've seen in a while.

1. About 90% of the champs you and the others are listing are **RANGED CHAMPIONS**
2. Ranged champs **SHOULD NOT** get great mobility.  If they did, that'd make melee champions even more unplayable.  There's a reason why the meta is "protect the ADC".  
3. {{champion:114}} Doesn't get countered by Zhonyas.  Just a mild inconvenience for her
I think those are only SOME of them, there are a lot more
{{champion:42}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:268}}
{{champion:104}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:115}}

Well, Zed is as good as range.
Q: 55 energy cost. 6s CD. Gains 60 Energy every 6s.
He can spamm his ranged ability on cooldown.
It also deals 60% less damage if it hits a minion before it.

but with zed's insane damage amplification that hardly matters. 

also not to be pedantic but it's 60% of the full damage or 40% less damage.

It's weaker for harass, so if you spam it, it isn't as effective as it sounds(if the target gets hit by both Qs, one will deal 50% less damage too, so it's 90% of the 1 normal Q dmg).

And yeah i screwed up, it deals 40% less damage, not 60%
But that's staggering compared with rangeless champ's 0 damage.

> [{quoted}](name=meatjunjun,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-01-08T09:45:48.838+0000)
>
> This is the dumbest "bash Zed" thread I've seen in a while.
> 
> 1. About 90% of the champs you and the others are listing are **RANGED CHAMPIONS**
> 2. Ranged champs **SHOULD NOT** get great mobility.  If they did, that'd make melee champions even more unplayable.  There's a reason why the meta is "protect the ADC".  
> 3. {{champion:114}} Doesn't get countered by Zhonyas.  Just a mild inconvenience for her

He can literally poke farther than Xerath.  How ranged can a champion be, exactly, while still considering them "melee"?

His long-range zoning, poke AND waveclear make him play similar to a mage, except with super strong auto attacks if he ults in on you to get up close coupled with extreme mobility.

> He can literally poke farther than Xerath

Yes, using W + Q which has a significant cooldown. On the other hand, Xerath can do the same exact thing every 5 seconds. There is a world of difference.
I think it's fair to assume this isn't the only way you are poking, the other responses assume that's all you are doing. the comparison of range is still a legitimate comparison.

You have never played Xerath or played against him then. Zed can poke you with great range (only W+Q which doesn't even deal that much dmg) every 18 seconds unless he for some dumb reasons maxes W(which makes the damage even lower). Xerath has 3 long range spells that he can spam as soon as he gets his Chalice.

If I'm understanding right, that long range poke you're talking about requires both shadow (W) + Q.  His shadow's CD is so long.  If that's the only way he's poking, I don't think he's playing Zed correctly.

> {{champion:114}}  Doesn't get countered by Zhonyas. Just a mild inconvenience for her

what? her ult hits champions 5 times. if you use Zhonyas in lane after the first hit then the other four hits are wasted. that's 80% damage reduction, that's pretty much a wasted ult.

If you're playing Fiora only for her ult then...
A) you're right.
B) you're doing it wrong.

Fiora's ult is a pseudo-Zonya's with a nuke attached. The majority of her damage comes from the rest of her kit.
i think i misread the post i was responding to, because you are absolutely right.

Zed is perfectly balanced as is, you can beat him easily in lane and if he doesn't get ahead he won't be assassinating your carries half as often. You can not only zhonyas his ult but QSS it which means all of his potential targets can escape, most of the champions on your list have aoe ults which means even if one person goes into zhonyas you will still kill someone else. And lastly is that most of the targets you will be assassinating are the adc's generally and will more often than not buy a QSS, gap close away (an exception here being Kog), and then you will have to ult back out of the fight or get fucked basically making you useless for the entire fight. Zed generally doesn't have enough damage with just his auto's and abilities to kill an adc fast enough to make a difference without his ult, they will generally QSS and kite him.
Yes you can Zhonya's Zeds ult. But dont even think of building anything other than seeker pre level 6 because if you do hes going to completely destroy you every time his ult is up.
His ult has a 2 minute cooldown at rank 1. That's a lot of time you can shit all over him.
not if the zed plays safely, and lets face it zed is one of the safest champs in the game right now.
Until you find out Lee Sin and Azir exist

well, lee sin has his own power problems but are you suggesting that lee turret dives zed? i don't think that's gonna work out for you most of the time. wait for lee to q to you, jump to your shadow, lee is under your turret and not close enough to attack you while zed can poke with e+q and let the turret do it's job. 

Azir doesn't have the range to even poke zed. zed can stand way behind turret, shadow into the minion wave, and use his e+q to farm. Azir wont be able to get close enough to drop his soldiers on zed to poke.

> Azir doesn't have the range to even poke zed. 

Joke of the day right there

not a joke there buddy, 

zeds shadow 550 + shuriken 900 range = 1450
Azir soldier 450 + conquering sands 800 = 1250

if Azir wants to poke he will be in zeds poke range, zed's q has shorter cd ,doesn't use mana, and zed has one more damage ability. Azirs soldiers have mele range so they are easy to walk away from. multiple hits from Azirs soldiers do 25% of the full damage, while zeds shadow shuriken does 60% of the full damage.

if you send all your soldiers to zed he will jump to his shadow and avoid all that poke, and he is well within range to land a q now and you will lose that trade because all your abilities are on cd while zed gets another q thanks to the shorter cd, you don't have your mobility ability because all your soldiers are now behind zeds turret, so zed can possibly land two qs while nothing of yours lands. 

it's not even a fair comparison.

Or Azir summons a soldier next to a minion, goes way back to his turret and orders the soldier to attack everytime Zed tries to farm :)

Maybe play Azir so you know how his W works next time

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=000700000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T19:40:54.017+0000)
>
> Or Azir summons a soldier next to a minion, goes way back to his turret and orders the soldier to attack everytime Zed tries to farm :)
> 
> Maybe play Azir so you know how his W works next time

Zed can use his shadows and shurikens to farm from range...
His W has a 18 second cooldown early game. Unless Zed decided he doesn't need farm you will outpoke him

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=00070000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T19:59:30.299+0000)
>
> His W has a 18 second cooldown early game. Unless Zed decided he doesn't need farm you will outpoke him

Are we pretending mana isn't a thing?

Ye the 40 mana cost soldiers are gonna starve Azir out of mana.

I have never ever ran out of mana as Azir even when spamming all my spells either. Have you actually played Azir?

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=0007000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T20:30:38.967+0000)
>
> Ye the 40 mana cost soldiers are gonna starve Azir out of mana.
> 
> I have never ever ran out of mana as Azir even when spamming all my spells either. Have you actually played Azir?

This is quite stupid.  If you pull up a game as Azir and spam your spells, you will go OoM.  Quickly.

This is not even a debatable point.  There are probably hundreds of Azir gameplays online already.  Pick one.  Your choice.  Watch him go out of mana *without* spamming.

Regardless.  Even if he was energy-based.  He'd still only be keeping up with Zed's free, never-ending harass.

EDIT: This wasn't about Azir anyway.  I thought you were still talking about champions like Xerath, who will get to out-poke him (or evenly poke him) for about a minute, and then are out of mana.  Even with his passive, he can't keep up with Zed.
he will go oom faster that zed.
waves are more than 18 seconds apart, thanks to his aoe waveclear and his passive he will still farm just fine.

> [{quoted}](name=Rainbowe Dash,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=97zr9loL,comment-id=000700000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-08T19:40:54.017+0000)
>
> Or Azir summons a soldier next to a minion, goes way back to his turret and orders the soldier to attack everytime Zed tries to farm :)
> 
> Maybe play Azir so you know how his W works next time

Zed than ults Azir under turret, recasts ultimate, then walks away :)
